item.title: Appendix C - Estimation and test results
item.description: H estimation by Whittle and Wavelet estimators. Chi square statistics and stationarity tests

item.title: Temperature Data
item.description:
The goal of this section is to describe the data used in the Temperature Fluctuation paper and how these data are organized. All the data are available in the tempFGN repository, and their organization strongly depend from the aim of the analysis that we have carried out.

Since the goal of our work was to study the historical variations of temperature fluctuations, we needed long temperatures time series, possibly for several weather station. We found a great solution in the data collected by Sigmund H. Moen, co-author of the paper and creator of the web page www.rimfrost.no, where most of the records are freely available.

item.title: About
item.description:
About Vanlog

We are a senior AI product studio.
We help teams turn applied AI research into reliable, production-ready systems.

Why we exist

Bulding AI products is deceptively easy. Making them work in production, scale over time, and be trusted by users is not. We started Vanlog to bridge the gap between AI research, product design, and real-world constraints, data quality, evaluation, costs, and long-term maintenance.

Director


Hi, I’m Andrea Melloncelli.

item.title: About
item.description:
We are a senior AI product studio.
We help teams turn applied AI research into reliable, production-ready systems.

Why we exist

Bulding AI products is deceptively easy. Making them work in production, scale over time, and be trusted by users is not. We started Vanlog to bridge the gap between AI research, product design, and real-world constraints — data quality, evaluation, costs, and long-term maintenance.

How we work

  1. Understand the problem
    We start from the use case, not from the model. Constraints, users, risks, data availability.

item.title: Agent Discovery (1 hour)
item.description:
In 60 minutes, we turn your idea into a concrete, actionable plan.

What you get: You receive a one-page summary with:

  • Use case tailored to your context
  • Data sources and required integrations
  • Identified risks and constraints
  • Next steps for your MVP

Who is it for?

  • Companies and teams exploring AI agents for the first time
  • Product owners and innovation leads with a specific challenge
  • Anyone who wants to move from idea to action, fast

What do you need?

  • A real business problem or opportunity
  • 60 minutes of your time (remote session)
  • Openness to discuss data, processes, and goals

What do you get?

  • A clear, actionable use case
  • List of data sources and integration points
  • Key risks and how to address them
  • Concrete next steps for your MVP

item.title: Training Courses
item.description:
Introduction

This set of courses are designed to teach concepts of Data Science and how to use statistical and machine learning methods to solve real business problems with Python. Courses come with a book with theory, exercises, Jupyter notebooks with practical examples, instructions how to install software and how to use it. The courses are designed to be interactive and practical. The students will learn by doing, by solving real business problems.
